  1. Description
  2. Classes and Interfaces

Package heparansulfate

package heparansulfate
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    AVSFormCons
    Creates an affine constraint in standard form (Ax = b, with rank(A) < dim(b) and b >= 0)and with artificial variables (for phase I of the simplex).
    BBSet
    Represents a set of chemical building blocks (e.g., disaccharides S and U), storing their unique labels and their relative abundances.
    CleavedSequence
    Represents a molecular chain that has been enzymatically or chemically cleaved.
    CoordDescNNQP
    Solution to nonnegative quadratic programming: minimize (1/2)x^TQx + c^Tx subject to x >= 0 via coordinate descent.
    CSpec
    Cleavage specificities, based on a BBSet object (set of building blocks) and a file giving specificity for each building block name.
    GradientWidth
    Utilizes linear programming to estimate bounds of S/U proportions at each position in chains.
    HCModel
    Homogeneous Markov model of species (chain sequence) abundances (model H&C).
    HCModelLIC
    Linear inequality constraints on a H&C model (homogeneous Markov model).
    HCModelSA
    Optimization of a homogeneous Markov model (model H&C) via simulated annealing to fit two heparinase digest constraint sets.
    HIModel
    Homogeneity and Independence (H&I) model: species abundances are defined by the overall disaccharide composition.
    HomogeneityFeasibility
    Feasibility problem solver (Phase I via Simplex) to test for the possibility of homogeneous disaccharide composition along BKHS chains when combined with heparinase digest constraints.
    LinEqCons
    Class that represents linear equality or inequality constraints: Ax = b or Ax <= b, where A is an m by n matrix and b is an m-dimensional vector.
    MatrixOp
    Provides static methods for common matrix and vector operations.
    MaxEntModel
    Represents a Maximum Entropy (MaxEnt) model of BKHS (profiles of composition and correlation) for cases where all chains have the same length.
    MaxEntModelW
    Maximum Entropy (MaxEnt) model of profiles of S/U composition and transition probabilities along BKHS chains when BKHS is represented with a mixture of chain lengths.
    MaxEntOptim
    Geometric programming for solving a Maximum Entropy (MaxEnt) problem subject to linear equality constraints in the probability simplex.
    MixSpecies
    Enumeration of sequences (species) with a specified chain length distribution.
    NIModel
    Represents a Nonhomogeneity and Independence (N&I) model: different building block composition at each position in a chain and independence between positions.
    NIModelLIC
    Linear inequality constraints on a Nonhomogeneity and Independence (N&I) model.
    NIModelSA
    Fits parameters of the N&I model using heparinase digest constraints via simulated annealing.
    ProfileFeasibility
    Calculates the infeasibility of a specific constraint set (overall disaccharide composition and heparinase digest) for BKHS chains of a given length n.
    ProjOnPolyHSet
    Projection of a vector y onto a polyhedral set (Ax <= b) via coordinate descent.
    SandVal
    Convenience class to sort pairs of strings and double values.
    SFormCons
    This class represents a linear constraint Ax = b in standard form: matrix A (m x n) has rank m < n and b >= 0.
    Simplex
    Simplex method for linear programming (Phase II).
    SimplexPhaseI
    Implementation of the Simplex method, but limited to Phase I.
    Species
    Enumeration of all possible sequences of length n with m disaccharides.
    Tableau
    Simplex tableau used for representing linear programming problems.
    Utils
    General utility methods, primarily handling I/O operations and basic statistics, used across several classes in the package.
